title: EasyDoc
subtitle: Open the camera to enhance the document
DBMSMText:
Database Manager Shared Memory
This is the shared memory area for the entire database manager instance, used to manage activity information for all database connections. It is allocated when the database manager starts (db2start) and released when the database manager stops (db2stop). The size of this area is automatically controlled by DB2.
AppGMText:
Application Global Memory 
Each database instance has its own global memory area, which includes multiple application heaps. An application heap is allocated for each application that connects to the database. The memory amount for each application can be limited by the 'applheapsz' parameter, and the total memory for all applications can be limited by the 'appl_memory' parameter. The diagram shows multiple application heaps, supporting multiple simultaneous connections, with the maximum number determined by the max_connections parameter.
DBInstanceText:
Database Instance
Database instance has its own global memory area, specified by the database_memory parameter. By default, this parameter is set to automatic, allowing DB2 to adjust the memory size as needed. Database global memory is used for storing buffer pools, log buffers, utility heaps, package caches, catalog caches, and lock lists.
MemoryText: System Memory includes all memory available on the server, encompassing the memory allocated for DB2 components like Application Global Memory, Database Global Memory, and Database Manager Shared Memory.
HeapText:
Heap
This is a memory segment allocated for each application that connects to the database. It stores data structures and resources needed by the application during its interaction with the database.
DBGMText:
Database Global Memory
Database Global Memory is a dedicated memory area for each database instance, which stores various data structures and caches essential for database operations.
What question: What kind of questions do you have?
Scan the documentation: Click on the image to open the AR camera, and focus on the document, making sure the document fragment is in the center of the screen
Scan the documentation2: Click on the image to open the AR camera, and focus on the image
Touch AR: After the scan is successful, the screen will display relevant enhanced content, and you can interact with the content by tapping the screen
Touch AR2: After the scan is successful, you can interact with the content by tapping the screen
How to use Chat Assistant: How to use documentation chat assistant
Click text box: Click on the text box to enter your question
Do the best: You can use our AI assistant as you would in a daily conversation and he will do his best to answer you
Do the best2: You can use our AI assistant as you would in a daily conversation
Set language: In settings, click the language dropdown to set the language
Set theme: In settings, click the theme dropdown to set either Day Mode or Night Mode
Welcome message: Our application can vividly display 2D documents
cameraAgreementText: We need access to your camera to provide Augmented Reality (AR) functionality. Please read and agree to our terms before using this feature.You can view the full terms in the settings.
privacy_agreement_details:
Thank you for your interest in our graduate project from the University of Bristol's Computer Science program. This project demonstration software page may request camera permissions. Please read the following privacy policy to understand how we handle your camera data. If you feel uncomfortable using our application, you can withdraw at any time.

1. Camera Permission

This software page may request access to your camera to enable certain demonstration features. We will only access the camera with your explicit permission.

2. Data Usage

Demonstration Purposes: Camera access is solely used for project demonstration and feature showcasing. No images or videos captured by the camera will be stored or transmitted.

3. Data Sharing

We do not share any data obtained through camera access with third parties. All camera data is used solely for local demonstration purposes.

4. Data Security

Since this project is for demonstration purposes only, we do not store or process any camera data. We ensure that the demonstration process will not pose any security threat to your device.

5. User Rights

You have the right to revoke camera permission at any time. Revoking the permission may impact the functionality of the demonstration features.

6. Contact Us

If you have any questions or need further information about this privacy policy, please contact us at:
fm19201@bristol.ac.uk
View the document directly: Click the document button,find the image outlined in red,and click it to view the 2D version.
